title: LOOKING FOR SIMILAR NOSTALGIC FONTS. please help
content:
im trying to brand a mock product and I’m aiming for an early 40’s -50’s look. I’m trying to find a font like this scripty one, or anything similar. Can anyone help find a similar nostalgic style font?  
 [http://img259.imageshack.us/my.php?image=scriptooldlogohp6.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080127071932/http:/img259.imageshack.us/my.php?image=scriptooldlogohp6.jpg "http://img259.imageshack.us/my.php?image=scriptooldlogohp6.jpg")

rss

 [‹ Matt laminate or Gloss for colour brightness and contrast?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080127071932/http:/typophile.com/node/38902 "Go to previous forum topic") [Approaching a handmade book ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080127071932/http:/typophile.com/node/38889 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Zuccs

comments.content:
This label looks ’20s-40s and the script is hand lettered, but here you go:

[Radio](http://web.archive.org/web/20080127071932/http:/vllg.com/Thirstype/Radio/Example+About/)  
 [Grocers Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20080127071932/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/wiescher/grocers_script/)  
 [Philly Sport Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20080127071932/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/urw/philly_sport_script_ot_std_urw/)
[Cabarga Cursiva](http://web.archive.org/web/20080127071932/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/letraset/cabarga-cursiva/) as mentioned by Mike F in the duplicate thread.
Awesome!!! thanks stephen Grocers Script and PHilly sport are almost exactly what im lookin for! thanks a lot!
